knowledge.title: Safeplace Default
knowledge.description: This knowledgebase describes all the relevant types of buildings and associated risks.

question.description: Are there children that regularly visit the building?
How old are the children that visit the building?

rule.description: Babies (between the age of 0-2) visit the building.
Small children (between age of 2-4) visit the building.
Medium children (between age of 4-12) visit the building.
Big children (older than 12) visit the building.
Non-autonomous children (younger than 12) visit the building.

rule.description: No children, no advice from this knowledge base.
If it is a multistory building and children have access to the stairs, the stair-risks may be important.
If there are sanitary rooms and small children visit the building, ask for Ankleedtafel.

question.description: Does the building have multiple stories?
Do children have access to any stairs?
Does the building have windows in rooms accessible to children?
Are the lowest windows more or less than 1m above the ground?
Is it possible to fall through the window because the glass is thin, the windows are sometimes left open and/or there are no bars in front of it?
Are children playing with toys in the building?
Does the building have sanitary facilities for adults?
Does the building have sanitary facilities for children?
Do the sanitary facilities have diaper-changing tables?
Are children eating in the building?
Are adults eating in the building?
Are meals prepared in the building?
Does the building have specific rooms for storing toys, tools or cleaning equipment?
Does the building have rooms/huts for storing toys or tools outside?
Does the building have rooms for storing toys or tools inside?
Does the building have an outer area that children have access to?
Are playground structures in the outside area, e.g. swings or a sandbox?
Is there a fence around the outer area?
Are trips with children starting or ending at the location in question?
Do children come to the building or leave the building without one of their guardians (e.g. do they go to the building after school)?
